bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jose R. Andreu, October 29, 1947

div1.p: Hench is disappointed that he has not heard from Andreu or Nogueira concerning plans for the Camp Lazear memorial. He informs Andreu of his scheduled visit to the Rockefeller Foundation to seek funds for the memorial.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jose R. Andreu, October 29, 1947
div1.opener:
same letter sent
Dr Nogueira
October 29, 1947
Dr. Jose R. Andreu
Minister of Public Health and Social Assistance
Republic of Cuba
Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Andreu:
div1.p:
When I received your letter of April 24, 1947, I was pleased
indeed to know that the Cuban Government intended to make the remains
of Camp Lazear and the little experimental building on the Finca San
Jose in Quemados a national monument. You asked what my plans were
concerning the preservation of this Caseta and I wrote you on May 16
in some detail. At that time I also heard from Dr. Pedro Nogueira,
General Director of Sanitation. I promptly replied and wrote him also
on May 16. I greatly regret that I have heard from nobody since then.
I am so anxious to see this venture carried through and the preservation
of the Caseta made certain. In my letter to you and Doctor Nogueira,
I asked certain questions. I would appreciate greatly indeed having
some sort of reply at your earliest convenience.

I intend to go to New York in two weeks and am asking for an
appointment with an associate of the Rockefeller Foundation in the hope
that I may interest them also in this venture but before going, I do
need answers to at least a few of the questions I asked. I am writing
also to Doctor Nogueira asking for his help in the matter. As I told
you previously, it is my deep desire to see to it that a little Cuban-
American medical memorial museum be erected to honor both Finlay and
the Americans who joined in the conquest of yellow fever. Will you
kindly give me the favor of a reply that I may receive before leaving
Rochester for New York on November 13.

If the matter is now out of your hands or if you should desire
to have others see this letter and in particularly my letter to you of
May 16, by all means please show the letters to them.
div1.closer: Sincerely, Philip S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
